info.title: Data Quiz
info.desc: What is Data? Characters and symbols might be data. Computers are designed to process data so it is important to understand what 'data' is and how it is different to 'information'.
info.Creator: Education Quizzes

questions.title: Data is...
alternatives: a character in a science fiction TV series
letters, numbers or characters with meaning
letters, numbers or characters with no meaning

questions.title: A storage location contains the digits  31122012.
alternatives: This might be a piece of data
This is certainly a piece of information

questions.title: Data is stored by computers in locations called...
Computers use binary code to store data because...
alternatives: binary code takes up less space
electronic circuits can only be 'on' or 'off'

questions.title: In most computers how many 'bits' make up a 'byte'?
Data enters a computer...
alternatives: before processing but after the entry stage

questions.title: Which is not a measure of storage size?
Data entered should be 'validated'. This means...
alternatives: it should be checked to make sure it contains no error
it should be checked to make sure it is correct
it should be checked to make sure it is sensible
it should be entered in small batches

questions.title: Data entered should be 'verified'. This means...
alternatives: it should be checked for viruses
it should be checked to make sure it is completely accurate
it should be checked to make sure it is entered correctly
it should be checked to make sure it is reasonable

questions.title: Which is not a means of entering data into a computer?

info.title: Chemistry Quiz
info.desc: Chemical reactions are all around us. We can see many reactions such as fireworks and explosions. Many are very useful, such as cooking and combustion. Others are equally vital but are not quite as obvious such as photosynthesis and respiration.
info.Creator: Education Quizzes

questions.title: What type of reaction occurs when hydrocarbons burn in an insufficient supply of oxygen?
What type of reaction occurs at the positive electrode when copper sulphate is electrolysed using copper electrodes?
What type of reaction does the following word equation describe? Magnesium + zinc chloride → magnesium chloride + zinc
What type of reaction occurs when limestone (calcium carbonate) is heated and becomes calcium oxide?
What type of reaction is shown by the following word equation? Hydrochloric acid + sodium hydroxide → sodium chloride + water
What type of reaction is shown in the symbol equation? Fe2O3 + 3CO → 2Fe + 3CO2
What reaction is occurring when decane is split into ethene and octane?
What reaction is involved in the hardening of vegetable oils?
What reaction is involved in the production of poly(ester)?
What is the only reaction that removes carbon dioxide from the atmosphere naturally?

info.title: Music Fundamentals Quiz
info.desc: The Fundamental Elements of Music are: Pitch, Duration, Dynamics, Tempo, Timbre, Texture and Structure. Have a go at the following quiz to see how much you've been taking notice in your Music lessons!
info.Creator: Education Quizzes

questions.title: Which element of music best describes how 'high' or 'low' notes sound?
In terms of duration, which is longest of these notes?
What is the purpose of dynamics in a piece of music?
alternatives: To express how loud or quiet the music should be played
To represent a change of speed
shTo show a change of time signature ark

questions.title: What does 'andante' mean?
What best describes the effect of a 'ritardando'?
Which of these instruments has a 'bright' timbre?
What is a 'homophonic' texture?
alternatives: Multiple voices varying a main melody simultaneously
The overlapping of several melodic voices in a piece
Where one voice stands out on top of a backing harmony

questions.title: What does the marking 'mezzo forte' (mf) mean?
Binary form is made up of how many sections?
alternatives: One (A)  a single section often repeated

questions.title: A minim is made up of how many quaver beats?
